author: .vbuterin
content: right, I get the point. I'm inclined to not worry too much about block-by-block fairness simply because every validator attests every epoch so everyone's bad luck will average out quickly anyway, but we definitely should make sure we're not increasing the absolute level of harshness

author: jgm
content: I would also say that if the net impact of the change will be to reduce rewards compared to the current system that wouldn't be great.  Netting out over validators is one thing, but a reduction for all validators is another.  I was thinking that TIMELY could move to perhaps "within three slots", or even use two bits for timeliness, representing "1,2-3,4-6" slots (for example).

author: .vbuterin
content: The HEAD reward already requires single-slot liveness in most cases, so attaching a single-slot inclusion requirement to it seems reasonable to me

author: .vbuterin
content: Though granted, in cases of high inactivity, it's unfair because you end up inevitably missing it a lot of the time; the fix we're mulling over at the moment is in the <2/3 case making the penalty-to-everyone smaller

author: jgm
content: I think a statement like "given the network conditions we have seen to date on mainnet, this will be net neutral on aggregate rewards" somewhere would be a good idea.  It would reduce concerns that this change would (inadvertently or by design) result in a reduction of rewards.

author: jgm
content: Would this also be a good time in which to add some sort of reward for picking the correct ETH1 head, or is it considered too much effort/complexity for something that will go away in the next year or two?

author: jgm
content: (Note that this isn't a massive problem right now; last voting period had 1,971/2,028 blocks agreeing.  But as the size of stakers' `geth` databases grows I can see more users shutting down their ETH1 nodes over time)
